snippet: If Adam Wainwright did Derek Jeter a favor by giving him an easy pitch to hit in Jeter’s final All-Star Game appearance on Tuesday night, he has company, at least in folklore.
abstract: St Louis Cardinals pitcher Adam Wainwright told reporters he grooved pitch for New York Yankees shortstop Derek Jeter in his last All-Star Game, but later said he was joking; if Jeter did receive such a favor, it is not the first; in 1968, Mickey Mantle accepted offer from Denny McLain to throw an easy pitch, and in 1963 Don Drysdale supposedly tipped a pitch to his former teammate Duke Snider, who hit it out of the park.
lead_paragraph: If Adam Wainwright did Derek Jeter a favor by giving him an easy pitch to hit in Jeter’s final All-Star Game appearance on Tuesday night, he has company, at least in folklore.

headline.seo: Grooving a Pitch to Hit Has a Modest Home in Baseball
headline.main: For a Parting Gift, Do You Want a Grapefruit or a Meatball?
headline.print_headline: For a Parting Gift, Do You Want a Grapefruit or a Meatball?
